title: Murshidabad (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Murshidabad (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="Murshidabad%20district">Murshidabad district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>.
Overview.
As per orders of the <a href="Delimitation%20Commission%20of%20India">Delimitation Commission</a>, No. 64 Murshidabad (Vidhan Sabha constituency) covers <a href="Murshidabad">Murshidabad</a> municipality, <a href="Jiaganj%20Azimganj">Jiaganj Azimganj</a> municipality and <a href="Murshidabad-Jiaganj%20%28community%20development%20block%29">Murshidabad Jiaganj</a> <a href="Community%20Development%20Block%20in%20India">community development block</a>
Murshidabad (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is part of No. 11 <a href="Murshidabad%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Murshidabad (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>.
Election results.
2011.
In the 2011 election, Shaoni Singha Roy of Congress defeated her nearest rival Bibhas Chakraborty of Forward Bloc.
1977–2006.
In the <a href="2006%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">2006 state assembly elections</a>, Bivas Chakraborty of <a href="All%20India%20Forward%20Bloc">Forward Bloc</a> won the Murshidabad assembly seat defeating his nearest rival Joyanta Roy of <a href="Indian%20People%27s%20Forward%20Bloc">IPFB</a>. Contests in most years were multi cornered but only winners and runners are being mentioned. <a href="Chhaya%20Ghosh">Chhaya Ghosh</a> of Forward Bloc defeated <a href="Abdul%20Mannan%20Hossain">Abdul Mannan Hossain</a>, Independent, in 2001. Mazammel Haque, Independent, defeated Abdul Ohab Mondal of <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress">Congress</a> in 1996, Chhaya Ghosh of Forward Bloc defeated Asak Ali of Congress in 1991. Abdul Mannan Hossain of Congress defeated Madan Mohan Ray, Independent, in 1987. Chhaya Ghosh of Forward Bloc defeated Dedar Bakshi of <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress%20%28Socialist%29">ICS</a> in 1982 and Syed Nawab Jani Meerza of <a href="Janata%20Party">Janata Party</a> in 1977.
1951–1972.
Mohammad Idris Ali of Congress won in 1972, 1971 and 1969. S.K.A.Mirza of Congress won in 1967. Birendra Narayan Ray, Independent, won in <a href="1962%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1962</a>. Durgapada Sinha of Congress won in <a href="1957%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1957</a> and in <a href="1952%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">independent India's first election in 1951</a>.
